job_title: Housing Director in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: True room for advancement, emphasis on older adult advocacy, employee focused. We care about the team members and the people we serve. I am thankful for the team in my community, the organizational leadership, and the support from our other communities.
cons: To me, cons may be the same across all healthcare settings, but I feel Ecumen makes great strides in acknowledging the cons and problem solving when able.

job_title: Sr. People Service Manager in Shoreview, MN
pros: I just had my 5 year anniversary! Ecumen team members make me feel appreciated and respect my experiences and knowledge. Great 401(k) Matching Program Everyone is focused on our mission. We're a team! People genuinely care.
cons: COVID has been rough! As a large organization, sometimes we're a little slow to adapt.

job_title: People Services in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Ecumen has a very nice hierarchy in place. My manager is fantastic as is each manager above. There are many corporate leaders who make an effort to know me beyond just my name. I love working with people who choose this industry for the right reasons
cons: Budget restrictions are my only con though they are unavoidable challenges due to covid recovery

job_title: Health Information Coordinator in Grand Rapids, MN
pros: Good benefits at Grand Village. Great retirement.
cons: Terrible place to work. Ecumen is the managing company and only seeks to take over ownership. The regional directors have no attachment or understanding or the rural community this facility is located in nor can they effectively advocate for this facility.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Co-workers, Residents, benefits, Holidays off if you are fulltime
cons: Horrible management at the corporate level. No accountability at site level for leadership. Will have leader who is involved in conflict with staff do the investigation which is unethical and one sided. They appear to be lazy and do not want to deal with ongoing site level concerns that they should address.

job_title: Data Analyst in Minneapolis, MN
pros: great place to work in
cons: takes long to review promotion

job_title: Resident Assistant in Apple Valley, MN
pros: I had so much fun working here. I loved the staff and residents, everybody was so kind. Ecumen paid very fairly. I worked here in 2017.
cons: Night shifts, however all nursing facilities need staff during the nights

review_title: residents make the world go round!
job_title: Life Enrichment Assistant in Apple Valley, MN
pros: Able to perform independently Able to utilize the knowledge we know will best support our residents Not micromanaged
cons: Inconsistent staffing Corporate makes decisions that appear to serve their needs not necessarily our building and residents

job_title: Staffing Specialist in Detroit Lakes, MN
pros: Flexible, great boss, leadership team is wonderful, great PTO benefits, beautiful facility, team oriented
cons: Not enough hours, the job itself was very stressful, staff always complaining about what units they’d have to be on. I understand there are staffing shortages but I still think there should have been more accountability for the staff that would constantly call in. That’s really it. It is a wonderful place to work. I’d recommend it to anyone.

job_title: Talent Acquisition in Bengaluru
pros:
Amazing Co-Workers, Ability to move up internally - there are internal mentor programs.
Great Benefits which include but of course are not limited to in Total almost 4 weeks of PTO - accrued, Caregiver and Crisis PTO (Seperate) up to 80 hours/year (accrued), 2 Floating Holidays, Paid Holidays and 6% matched, immediately vested 401(k)
cons: I have yet to find any yet...

job_title: Resident Assistant (RA) in Moorhead, MN
pros: They’re amazing to work for the residents are amazing good company!!! Good benefits!! It’s a smaller memory care unit so it’s relaxed!
cons: Being mandated alot ! Scheduling is rocking but you figure it out amongst the other workers

job_title: Dining Assistant in Apple Valley, MN
pros: Caring management, efficient operations, fun staff, and flexible scheduling.
cons: Some of the other part-time workers were difficult to work with.

job_title: Customer Care Consultant in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
Ecumen is an employee centered company. The Management finds new ways to enhance the work atmosphere and Management/ Employee relationship. 

It is a very "Family Centered" company. There is a focus on a great work/life balance. 

I feel like a valued employee and work with positive, happy people.
cons: I work remotely so I sometimes miss the daily, physical interaction with co-workers.

job_title: Executive Director, Non-Profit in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Team Member-focused organization that does what they can for
cons: Work life balance is a challenge at the site leader level.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Fargo, ND
pros:
-Positive Work Environment
- Great Co Workers
-Great Benefits
-Good Pay
cons: -Small budgets to work with within departments.

job_title: Dinning Services in Park Rapids, MN
pros: Its a nice community and a great place to work
cons: They were really short on CNA's

job_title: Resident Services Coordinator in Maplewood, MN
pros: Involved management, happy team members, wonderful residents
cons: Large site, many residents to care for

job_title: Director Independent and Affordable Living in Shoreview, MN
pros: Ecumen has a well thought out mission that is strongly supported from top leadership and downward throughout the organization. They exemplify a very strong commitment to their customers (residents) and to their customer's families and loved ones. Also, I have never before been part of an organization that is so positively focused on all of its team members and again this philosophy is from the top down and is very real. They practice what they preach and, as a result, is a very unique and enjoyable company to work for with a very dedicated and positive work force. Happy to be part of the Ecumen team!
cons: Like so many other companies, COVID-19 has impacted Ecumen greatly and in many ways. While it is of no fault of their own, the shortage of available employees at times has caused stress and has forced teams to make necessary adjustments on the spur of the moment. If more individuals seeking a good employer and who are looking to stay for an extended period of time were to apply for positions at Ecumen, it would make life much easier and allow more time for team members to focus on and care for their residents.

job_title: Regional Director of Operations in Shoreview, MN
pros: Flexible and positive work environment
cons: Lack of standardization among service lines. Working towards a solution.

job_title: Concierge in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Mostly-friendly residents, earnest management, plenty of downtime
cons: Under-staffed, sometimes too much downtime, humans

job_title: Resident Assistant (RA) in Apple Valley, MN
pros: Fun place to work. Residents make it worth while it is a happy environment around the residents.
cons: Not getting paid enough for the amount of work I have to do, very busy very fast passed.

job_title: Business Office Associate in Shoreview, MN
pros: It's a good place to work.
cons: Not much for cons in my opinion

review_title: Grand Village Great place to start
job_title: Registered Nurse in Remer, MN
pros: county owned, great benefits, flexible scheduling
cons: limited opportunities for registered nurses

review_title: Good Company, but Changes Could be Made
job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: I believe Ecumen really cares about and wants what is best for the residents that live within their communities.
cons: There is big divide between those who work at the "corporate office" vs those who work directly at a community. Upper management or those who work at the corporate office will ask for opinions, but they are empty questions. There is never any follow up and suggestions are not taken into account. They believe they know what is best and what works best even though they rarely step foot at the site level.

job_title: Resident Assistant-CNA in Rosemount, MN
pros: They have dwindled down to say the least
cons: Leadership, corporate, too many policy changes, high turnover rates, working short staffed.

review_title: Good company, hard to get full time.
job_title: Maintenance Technician in New Richmond, WI
pros: Excellent working environment. Working here makes you feel like you are giving back to the community.
cons: Part time work as a maintenance mechanic. Often held up by funding, so residents sometimes have to make do with sub-par services like heating and living conditions. Expected to be on call without any extra pay, can be extremely inconvenient.

job_title: Cook Assistant in Edina, MN
pros: It was easy and short hours
cons: Understaffed and terrible management very stressful

job_title: Housing Specialist in Park Rapids, MN
pros: My 2 years with Ecumen at Heritage Community have been excellent! My supervisors have been so supportive and kind, helping me learn and grow in my position. Residents are treated with care and thoughtfulness by the staff.
cons: No downside that I have observed.

job_title: Registered Nurse Manager in Mankato, MN
pros: Great co-workers that are team players
cons: Wages could be more competitive

job_title: Housekeeper in North Branch, MN
pros: Good place to work. Nice people.
cons: It tends to be gossipy amongst the coworkers.

review_title: Best company I've ever worked for
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Duluth, MN
pros:
Friendly staff, good company culture.

REAL opportunities for advancement.

Great benefits - they offer so much more than the standard medical/ dental/ 401k for all employees, not just the "higher ups." Side note: my boyfriend works for the railroad; they have a reputation for great benefits. Mine are pretty comparable and I don't even have a very high ranking job with this company.

Rewarding work with residents/ patients.
cons:
Pay is comparable or slightly lower than other facilities in our area. 
Can be hard work, but it's the nature of the job. All other jobs I've held in this field at other companies have been just as difficult but less rewarding.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Burnsville, MN
pros: Nice place to work at
cons: Nothing that I can think of

review_title: It can only get better from here right?
job_title: R N in Austin, MN
pros: Absolutely love my coworkers. (There's only a select few that ruin it, as with anywhere). Never a shortage of hours when you want to pick up. Variety of patients/residents. Great first nursing job to gain experience.
cons: Very little room for advancement. More mandation than there should ever be. Extra short staffed. Upper management (the ones who count), are clueless. Extremely underpaid for this position.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Shoreview, MN
pros: Employees are allowed a lot of autonomy and responsibility.  There is a really good work/life balance, willing to be flexible for employees personal lives. The company is expanding quickly in a high growth industry.
cons:
Employees across the board have too much responsibility, initiatives are pushed out without considering time allowances.. Leaders do not hold employees accountable for poor performance and others suffer because of it.  Employees are not mentored or developed.

Market themselves as non-porfit, pay the employees accordingly.  Development and divesture initiatives are not altruistic.

review_title: Ecumen is a great place to work!
job_title: in Shoreview, MN
pros: Ecumen is one of the most flexible and friendly environments I have ever worked in.  The work is complex and challenging, but very rewarding.  We serve our residents and their families so you really feel good about the work we do.  I really like the Velocity Leadership Program - it is a great program to reflect on your leadership style and develop further as a leader.
cons: I think the company has some work to do around individual goal setting and developing training that can assist all employees with their development.  Some of this is offered however it would be nice if more options were available.

job_title: Regional Operations Director in Shoreview, MN
pros: I have been in the "caring" industry for 40 years, acute, long term and assisted and served in a number of leadership roles. Ecumen is the most caring, employee centered work site that I have been involved with. The Leadership Team truly cares for those who work here and are committed to caring for those we are entrusted to care for. There is a strong willingness to help one another and to assist one another in succeeding.
cons: I can honestly say nothing comes to mind

review_title: A value-focused and dedicated company to work for.
job_title: Business Analyst in Shoreview, MN
pros: I have had an extremely positive experience working for Ecumen and it feels like things are getting even better. The company is great and really does care about our mission, and I have seen some amazing things from my fellows, especially during the COVID-19 situation. Our leadership has never been more helpful, understanding, and forward-thinking in the time I've worked here than they are now. Service, kindness, and dedication are the core values I feel guide this company's culture the most. All-around, it is a fantastic organization to be a part of.
cons: None I can think of.

job_title: Sales and Marketing Manager in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Amazing to discover a company that only continues to impress over time in the fact they absolutely "talk the talk and walk the walk" when it comes to upholding core values of Honor, Serve, Empower & Innovate! Incredible leadership and mentoring in development of body, mind and spirit!
cons: Absolutely none. Everyday is an exercise in raising the bar and improving so even a con doesn't stay a con because it is addressed and resolved!

review_title: If you are going to work as PCA do it with CountrySide
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Owatonna, MN
pros:
Great Pay
Great Benefits 
Great balance of time with residents and passing meds
Very flexible in terms of creating a schedule to work with your outside life
cons:
Like with all employers there will be some employees that can be tough to get along with.
Overall the pros out weigh the cons.

job_title: Executive Director in Omaha, NE
pros: Very little to say.  The benefits were okay, but out of network if you aren't a Minnesota resident. Inconvenient for those working at a managed site.
cons: May have been a great place to work in previous years, my experience with Ecumen proves this to be completely bogus. Management is deceitful, misleading  and non supportive just to serve their own means and pockets. No support with unrealistic micro management!

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Litchfield, MN
pros: Good teamwork for the most part between the nursing assistants and staff nurses. Also, the other floor nurses were a great support to each other.
cons: Upper management not very supportive of floor staff. I was personally was falsely accused of stealing money from a resident. And yet I was allowed to keep my job! Probably because they had no real proof and this particular manager had a personal grudge against me.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros: My first month at Ecumen's Abiitan Mill City in downtown Minneapolis was above and beyond welcoming, supportive, and stimulating. I'm so impressed by the company's organized and detailed oriented on-boarding process. As well, my heart has already fallen for this vibrant, progressive, and urban community. I'm excited for our Abiitan team's future and grateful to be a part of it.
cons: I have none to speak of.

job_title: Executive Director in North Branch, MN
pros: As a newer employee with Ecumen, I am so impressed with this organization.  Ecumen clearly cares about their employees and provides support and opportunity at all levels.  I've worked in health care for over 30 years and this is truly the best organization I have ever worked for.
cons: At this point, I cannot think of a "con".

job_title: Dining Room Attendant in Apple Valley, MN
pros: The elderly people are awesome to work with. It is fun to get to know them, they have so much wise information to pass on to us.
cons: There is not very many bad things to working there, but there is a lot of people who work there, so its very hard to find the hours that you need

job_title: Activities Assistant in Harrisburg, PA
pros: Great coworkers and residents. Wonderful lunches for cheap.Hardest working nas on the planet. Good training. Learned much about healthcare.
cons: Low wages. Hard burnout work. Too many residents per na. High turnover of coworkers especially nursing assistants. Not a lot of support.

job_title: in Maplewood, MN
pros: Wonderful residents to work with especially in memory care.
cons: Top-down decisions from management dictate programs offered . No raise in two years despite promises after one year of employment.

job_title: Dining Assistant in Sandpoint, ID
pros: Great residents to work with. Definitely no shortage of hours. Most of the staff is nice a few ruin it (like every where)
cons: Extremely poor management. Certain managers you never even see. Absolutely no room for growth and terrible pay for what we do. Hardly over min wage even tho the company brings in close to 5 million (max)

job_title: Staff Accountant II in Shoreview, MN
pros: Great opportunity for those early in their career to learn and grow.  Great people. Great work/life balance.
cons: Pay is well below market rates. Advancement is based on seniority rather than performance.

job_title: Executive Director in Maplewood, MN
pros: I just started working at Ecumen this week and have had a wonderful experience thus far...I'm excited to continue my journey here and so far all the people have been amazing.
cons: I don't have any at this time.

job_title: Manager in Saint Paul, MN
pros: excellence is important to the culture and people are pros in their area of expertise. Seems like most people just got a pay bump too
cons: none I can think of at the moment

job_title: Nurse Assistant in Nya, MN
pros:
Wonderful residents
Upbeat work environment
Lots of walking/moving
Opportunities to form new/fun relationships with older adults
cons:
Hard work
During many shifts, you have to go without a meal break
You work inside the entire time

job_title: Back of the House Team Member in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Friendly employees, great life/work balance, decent pay.
cons: Sometimes other employees don't pull their weight.

job_title: Housekeeper in North Branch, MN
pros: Good place to work with people who care about the residents.
cons: The people are nice, but tend to gossip a lot.

job_title: Director of Clinical Services in Brooklyn Center, MN
pros: Faith based organization, Puts patients first, value employees.
cons: Nothing, nothing, nothing, nothing, nothing.

review_title: overall a good place to work
job_title: Resident Assistant in Apple Valley, MN
pros: My co workers and the residents
cons: I wish they had more recognition and appreciation to the employees

job_title: in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Ecumen has a great business growth plan and a strong future. I enjoy the constant changes and new opportunities.
cons: As in any organization, with growth comes challenges.....

job_title: CNA in Chisago City, MN
pros: loved working for Ecumen. Great management, great work atmosphere. Professional and flexible.
cons: None. Kept improving. I have zero complaints

job_title: Resident Assistant in Brooklyn Center, MN
pros: I loved working at ecumen. The management was friendly
cons: I have nothing bad to say about this place

job_title: Director of EVS in North Branch, MN
pros: Great Staff to work with, not much HR support
cons: They are not up front about your job duties

job_title: Executive Director in Chisago City, MN
pros: Great company, great resources, great overall
cons: Low pay, poor benefits, no incentives

job_title: Resident Services Coordinator in Maplewood, MN
pros: I enjoy everything about my job
cons: There are none for me !

job_title: Cook in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Great place to work. Great environment
cons: Sometimes long hours and long days

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Anoka, MN
pros: Was hired on quickly. Was offered Full time.
cons: full time doesn't mean a thing. I was lucky to get 13 hours a week!

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in North Branch, MN
pros: Helping residents, making a difference
cons: Management! You aren’t treated with respect unless you are considered a “director”
